dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 2118 IH: Medical Device Servicing Safety and Accountability Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Costello of Pennsylvania (for himself and Mr. Peters) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to require the registration of establishments that service devices, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Medical Device Servicing Safety and Accountability Act.

subsection.text: Section 510 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 360) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Registration of Servicing Establishments; Complaint Handling

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall, not later than 18 months after the date of the enactment of this subsection, issue final regulations requiring any person who owns or operates any establishment in any State engaged in the servicing of a device or devices, or is otherwise engaged in the servicing of a device or devices, to register with the Secretary. Such regulations shall—

subparagraph.text: specify the timing, format, and information to be submitted by any such person;

require that such a person establish a complaint handling system equivalent to a system meeting the requirements of section 820.198 of title 21, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations); and
provide for an exemption from such registration that—

clause.text: applies to servicing operations conducted by a device user facility (as defined in section 519(b)(6)), or a physician office operating in accordance with any applicable State or local laws; and
does not apply to device servicing operations conducted by persons who contract with device user facilities or physician offices to service devices.

paragraph.text: In this subsection, the term servicing includes, with respect to a device, refurbishing, reconditioning, rebuilding, remarketing, repairing, or other servicing of the device by a person other than the manufacturer of the device.
Section 519(a) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 360i(a)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking manufacturer or importer each place it appears and inserting manufacturer, servicer, or importer;
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: In this subsection, the term servicer means any person who is engaged in servicing (as such term is defined in subsection (r) of section 510)) and required to register with the Secretary under such subsection.
Not later than 18 months after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Health and Human Services shall issue final regulations implementing the amendments made by paragraph (1).
